This application was submitted to the Android@Vidi Android programming contest held by the Croatian tech magazine VIDI. More info is available at http://android.vidilab.com

(There are many reasons as to why one should keep a journal. In case you want to read up on this, there is a great article on journalling here : http://ririanproject.com/2006/09/22/10-reasons-to-keep-a-journal)\nThis app is meant to provide you with a small and flexible notepad into which you can input your thoughts, observations and important events. Giving you the ability to write entries from anywhere in your phone by long-pressing the search button, you can now record thoughts on the fly. And to make sure that things do not get messy, you can tag entries so that entries that have common content (for example those that could be grouped under jokes) can be read in a single thread simply by clicking on one of the entries.\nWith this app you can keep track of important things in your life, get better insight into your own thoughts and quickly type down things that you would usually forget.

Journal (com.psegina.journal) is a free open source application created mainly in it\'s creator\'s free time. Seeing as I would like to learn more about Android and programming in general, I would like you to help me make this application as good as possible. So, on this page I have listed several ways in which you as a user can contribute.

Believe it or not, we value the voice of our every user. If you have an idea that you think should be implemented or you have some suggestions about improving this application, feel free to let us know, either by leaving a comment on the Android Market, or sending us an email!\nLikewise, if you find a bug, or something that isn\'t working the way it should be, let us know so that we can fix it as soon as possible!

Android is an open platform used by people all over the world. Most of these people are not native English speakers (and neither am I). So if you have some wicked language skills and would like to translate this app, feel free to contact us!

Likewise, if you are a programmer and think some things could be done better, feel free to take a look at the source code available on gitHub. And if you get any ideas, be sure to send us the improvements!
Finally, if you would like to help this project grow by donating, you can do so via AlertPay. Every little bit helps!
